div.p: I am sending what I know will be most pleasing to you, namely the deliberation of those who were recently at the Saxon synod; but on the condition that you ensure two copies are made, one to be sent to Bassafontanum and the other to Baionensem. I would have taken care of it here, but there was no leisure; for the messenger, who came to Schaffhausen, is pressing and gives me no more than an hour's time. In other matters, there is nothing new.
The prince was here for three days with two other princes, Wolfgang of the Palatinate and the Margrave of Baden, along with their wives.

I have done much with him, who indeed is fervent in the gospel; this you should certainly know. I hope that a certain friend will send to you within a few days about fifty crowns, which belong to me; you will keep them for me until I write to whom they should be given; I know with whom I will deposit them. Farewell, my dearest Bullinger, dearest of all, I say. May the Lord increase heavenly gifts to you and your family and the church and the school through Christ our Lord. I bid all greetings from God.
